app_descript:
Aussie Bird Count

Brief: Aussie Bird Count is an ornithological engagement app that enables users in Australia to be part of a nationwide bird survey initiative. By signing up and reporting bird sightings through a user-friendly interface, this tool helps to track and monitor the avian population across the country. The practical in-built Field Guide is tailored to support both beginners and experienced birdwatchers in the identification of Australian bird species.

Core Features:

  1. Easy Sign-Up & Count Submission: Start by simply signing up with your name and email, choose your location, and begin your bird count. üìç
  2. Built-in Field Guide: With nearly 400 bird species listed, the guide aids in accurate bird identification. üìö
  3. Bird Search Optimization: The app allows for general searches to ensure better results when looking for bird names or species. üîç
  4. Year-Round Access: The Field Guide remains available throughout the year, allowing ongoing learning about Australian birds. üê¶
  5. Informative Resources: Direct links to FAQs and information about BirdLife Australia‚Äôs work and how to get involved. üåê

Pros:

  1. User-Friendly Interface: Designed for ease of use, so even beginners can participate without hassle. üëå
  2. Contribution to Conservation: Helps BirdLife Australia in wildlife preservation efforts. üåø
  3. Educational Asset: A great tool for learning about different species and developing birdwatching skills. üéì
  4. Regular Updates: Maintains to-the-minute data during bird counting events. üîÑ
  5. Community Involvement: Encourages active community participation in conservation activities. üë•

Cons:

  1. Limited Species in Field Guide: With less than half of Australia's species represented, some birds might be missing from the guide. üìâ
  2. Requires Internet Connection: For location selection and data submission, a reliable internet connection is necessary. üì∂
  3. Registration Required: Some users might prefer an app that does not require sign-up to participate. ‚úçÔ∏è
  4. Primarily Event-Focused: The app is centered around the bird counting event, which might limit its appeal off-season. ‚è≥
  5. Learning Curve: New users may need time to effectively navigate the Field Guide and reporting system. üß†

Price:

  • The Aussie Bird Count app is free to download and use. There are no current in-app purchases or hidden costs detailed. üí∞

Please visit the official Aussie Bird Count website and consider visiting BirdLife Australia to learn more about their initiatives and how to get involved. The app was developed by Planticle, which specializes in functional app development.

(Note: If any social media presence or community platforms specifically related to the Aussie Bird Count app or BirdLife Australia were found, they would be included here in the Community section.)
